intro: Rochea venusta, commonly known as the showy rochea, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Rochea venusta is prized in horticulture for its ornamental value and is cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
